summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Paul A. Engelmayer, requesting extensions of deadlines in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times Company against the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for records related to Jeffrey Epstein. The government seeks more time to prepare documents for in camera review, citing coordination among multiple prosecution teams and the BOP.

persons.name: Paul A. Engelmayer
persons.context: Presiding judge over the FOIA case The New York Times Co. v. Federal Bureau of Prisons. The letter is addressed to him requesting deadline extensions.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose office represents the defendant BOP in the FOIA case. The letter is respectfully submitted by her.

persons.name: Steven J Kochevar
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed and submitted the letter to the court, requesting deadline extensions for the government's document production related to Jeffrey Epstein records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender. The FOIA lawsuit seeks BOP records related to him, specifically surrounding his death in custody.

connections.description: Strauss is the United States Attorney and Kochevar is an Assistant United States Attorney in her office, as indicated by the letter's signature block.
Kochevar, as an AUSA, is formally communicating with and making requests to Judge Engelmayer in his official capacity regarding the FOIA case.

events.title: Original Document Production Deadline
events.description: The original court-ordered deadline for the government to complete its initial production of BOP records related to Jeffrey Epstein for in camera review.

events.title: Requested New Production Deadline
events.description: The government's requested new deadline (a two-day extension) to finalize and submit the initial document production for the court's in camera review.

events.title: Original Deadline for Remaining Documents
events.description: The original court-ordered deadline for the government to produce any remaining documents for in camera review.

events.title: Requested Extended Deadline for Remaining Documents
events.description: The government's requested one-month extension for the deadline to produce any remaining documents for in camera review.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The New York Times Company filed a FOIA lawsuit (20 Civ. 833) against the Federal Bureau of Prisons seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY, representing the BOP, requested its first extensions of court deadlines to produce documents for in camera review.
The government cited the complexity of the review, requiring coordination among 'multiple prosecution teams and the BOP' to finalize redactions.
The Times consented to the government's request for deadline extensions.
The government filed a separate ex parte and under seal submission explaining the need for a longer extension regarding remaining documents.
